titleStmt.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia for the counties of Thurston, Lewis, Chehalis and Mason.
In the matter of the application of S W Hall, for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

Upon reading and filing the petition of S W Hall, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that the petitioner, S W Hall, is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of said Thurston County, at the county jail in said Thurston County, in the Territory of Washington, and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue: It is ordered, that a writ of Habeas Corpus isse out of and under the seal of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia in and for said Thurston County, directed to the said William Billings, sheriff as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of the said petitioner before me; in the Court room of the said District Court at Kalama on the 7th day of January 1879, at 10 o'clock A.M. of that day or soon thereafter as may be possible to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said petitioner, together with the time and causes of his detention, and that he have then and there the said writ.
Dated January 6th 1879 Roger S. Greene Judge
Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus
